embeds.title: Charred Glove
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you draw a **Curse**, your next attack deals 3 more damage.
*Parts of the glove still glow with otherworldly cinders.*

:sencheese:

"Downfalls own data is certainly going to be amongst the least useful of the ones put together for this reason, it has changed A L O T over time"
-Sandtag
Still waiting on them to add Book of stabbing

Very low impact relic, especially unfortunate as it's rare. Compares incredibly poorly to akabeko, though they function a little bit differently (burst damage vs theoretical sustainable scaling). You need to generate and draw a curse (or have curses just in your deck) for it to do anything, and it really needs a multi hit or snapshot to take advantage of the vigor effectively. Worth noting that old locket puts the memento into your hand, which will not trigger the "draw" condition on charred glove. The amount of vigor you are getting is very low, it likely won't trigger until at least turn 3/4 in the fight even if you can generate curses (ascenders bane will give 1 proc at some point though), and it's asking you to do something that is inherently bad to support it (put curses in your deck). I cannot think of any situation where I would buy this from a shop, and it's a super disappointing rare relic to get randomly from a chest/elite/event. Just awful. It's right around stone calendar tier as far as rare relics go.
I'm convinced the only reason this relic exists is just so that the act 3 hermit boss can use it

for the players its a rare relic thats dependent on having several other cards to even do anything; it is quite good if you have the support for it but if you don't have enough curse generators its basically useless
probably does well with <clasped locket>

embeds.title: Clasped Locket
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

Replaces Old Locket. First time you draw a curse each turn, **Exhaust** it and draw 2 cards. Upon pickup, obtain 2 Injuries.
*It won't open anymore.*

messages.content: I've thought about a comperison we can make with this relic and thats <charron's ashes>

embeds.title: Charon's Ashes
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Whenever you **Exhaust** a card, deal 3 damage to ALL enemies.
*Charon was said to be the god of rebirth, eternally dying and reviving in a burst of flame.*

messages.content: charons ashes is a rare relic that also gives you 3 damage for using a specific kind of card (in the form of AOE in this case).

however the difference here is that most of ironclads card pool has the word "exhaust" on it so even in runs where you don't have a exhaust centered deck (using a card like corruption or fiend fire) this relic still has okay value; plus its quite excellent when you do have the powers to make it give you 12+ damage a turn

meanwhile charred glove isnt far behind damage wise. With 3 vigor being equal to charons ashes in a single target fight; but also having the abitily to be paired with mutli hit cards making it even stronger. But what is different is that hermit isnt all in on curses; its common for you to have a deck that only has accender's bane and when that happens Charred glove is pretty awful.
in other words; charred glove is a failed attempt at recreating charon's ashes for hermit since its way too situational

I think that part of the issue is that the reward doesn't justify what it's asking you to do. Most of the multihits are rares you may not see (though one is a pretty good common), and drawing curses is normally really bad (hermit does have tools to mitigate/change that to some extent). If this gave block as the payoff (like shadow cloak), I'd be more interested in doing what it asks. It just doesn't feel enough like a rare effect. Akebeko at common gives you a full 8 vigor right away for free, this needs to proc three times over the course of a fight to match that, and many fights won't even last that long. 

Charons ashes asks a lot less of ironclad (exhausting cards is already good to thin your deck, and is well supported), and gives immediate AOE damage. Glove is much harder to support and deals less damage in AOE fights.

To compare it to akabeko, akabeko is also turn 1 damage which is worth a lot more valuable. Even in the event that it procs 3 times, it is a character specific rare relic. It shouldn't just be "going even" with a common shared relic

I understand that especially for class specific relics you can have then be more focused (for examples snecko skull doing literally nothing for discard or shivs, only helping with poison) but hermit's curse archetype directly opposes dead on and the two do not mesh well, and usually you go all in on one or the other.

So half the time (assuming you run curse decks half the time) it won't get any effect, whereas with snecko skull you can pick up 1-2 poison cards as they don't clash against shiv/discard decks like curses do to dead on, nor does running some poison require as much buildup as a curse deck setup would
<akabeko>

embeds.title: Akabeko
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Your first Attack each combat deals 8 additional damage.

messages.content: Common relic giving you more valuable than a rare character specific one with a simular effect is a really bad sign for the balance of the game
Akabeko Also has amazing synergies with bottled attacks often letting you end fights wit one or two attacks

For a character who uses revolver which are know for their impressive fire rate given the wielder skill Hermit really doesn't have that many multihit attacks
He can either spray and pray and miss half his shots or shoot only once and hit the target
Sounds like a skill issue
